Operation 'get-transactions' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is too generic ('Get all transactions'). Description contains deprecation notice that should be removed for clarity. Missing explicit details about required parameters (at least one must be provided), what the response contains (Transaction objects), and pagination mechanism. Improved version clarifies the filtering requirements, pagination behavior, and return value for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Versions 1 and 2 of the Transfers API are deprecated. If you are just starting your implementation, use the latest version.

Returns all the transactions related to a balance account, account holder, or balance platform.

When making this request, you must include at least one of the following:
- `balanceAccountId`
- `accountHolderId`
- `balancePlatform`.
 
This endpoint supports cursor-based pagination. The response returns the first page of results, and returns links to the next and previous pages when applicable. You can use the links to page through the results.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve transactions for a balance account or holder
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all transactions associated with a specified balance account, account holder, or balance platform. At least one of the following query parameters must be provided: `balanceAccountId`, `accountHolderId`, or `balancePlatform`. The response uses cursor-based pagination and includes links to navigate through pages of results. Returns a paginated list of Transaction objects with details about each transaction.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic ('Get all transactions'). Description contains deprecation notice that should be removed for clarity. Missing explicit details about required parameters (at least one must be provided), what the response contains (Transaction objects), and pagination mechanism. Improved version clarifies the filtering requirements, pagination behavior, and return value for better AI agent decision-making.

Returns a transaction.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific transaction by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the details of a specific transaction by its unique identifier. Returns a Transaction object containing comprehensive information about the transaction including amount, counterparty details, status, and timestamps. Requires the transaction ID as a path parameter.
data.reasoning: Original summary and description are extremely vague. Description only states 'Returns a transaction' without context. message: Operation 'post-transfers' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and actionable. Description has good context about supported destinations and permissions, but lacks clarity about the immediate response (202 Accepted, returns transfer ID) and the asynchronous nature of the operation. Missing explicit mention of what the response contains and that the actual transfer result comes via webhook. Improved description clarifies the request/response contract and the asynchronous processing model for better AI agent understanding of operation flow.

data.current_description:
Versions 1 and 2 of the Transfers API are deprecated. If you are just starting your implementation, use the latest version.

Starts a request to transfer funds to:
- [Balance accounts](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/balanceplatform/latest/post/balanceAccounts)
 - [Transfer instruments](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/legalentity/latest/post/transferInstruments)
 - [Third-party bank accounts](https://docs.adyen.com/payouts/payout-service/pay-out-to-bank-accounts)
 - [Third-party cards](https://docs.adyen.com/payouts/payout-service/pay-out-to-cards)
 
Adyen sends the outcome of the transfer request through webhooks.

To use this endpoint:
- Your API credential must have the **TransferService Webservice Initiate** [role](https://docs.adyen.com/platforms/manage-access/webservice-roles/?tab=transfers_3).
 - The account holder must have the required [capabilities](https://docs.adyen.com/platforms/verification-overview/capabilities).
 
Reach out to your Adyen contact to set up these permissions.
data.description_suggestion: Initiates a transfer request to move funds to a balance account, transfer instrument, third-party bank account, or third-party card. Requires a TransferInfo request body specifying the destination and amount. Returns a 202 Accepted response with transfer details and a unique transfer ID. The transfer outcome is delivered asynchronously via webhooks. Requires the **TransferService Webservice Initiate** role and the account holder must have the necessary capabilities enabled.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description has good context about supported destinations and permissions, but lacks clarity about the immediate response (202 Accepted, returns transfer ID) and the asynchronous nature of the operation. Missing explicit mention of what the response contains and that the actual transfer result comes via webhook. Improved description clarifies the request/response contract and the asynchronous processing model for better AI agent understanding of operation flow.
